@notice Sets the address of the Proxy implementation to clone.
@param _proxyImplementationAddress The address of the Proxy implementation to clone.
nodes.name: setImplementationAddress
deploy
clone

attributes.documentation: @title A factory for deploying EIP-1167 clones of upgradable Proxy contracts.
attributes.name: ProxyCloneFactory

attributes.documentation:
@notice Sets the address of the Proxy implementation to clone.
@param _proxyImplementationAddress The address of the Proxy implementation to clone.
attributes.name: setImplementationAddress
deploy
clone

deploy(address,bytes).details: Grants ownership of the deployed proxy to itself, allowing the proxy to invoke     its own administrative functions if the logic contract permits (use extra caution     with implementations that permit arbitrary function calls).

params.implementation: The address to point the Proxy to.
params.initCallData: The function to call on the implementation and the corresponding args.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._proxyImplementationAddress: The address of the Proxy implementation to clone.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: A factory for deploying EIP-1167 clones of upgradable Proxy contracts.

deploy(address,bytes).notice: Creates an EIP-1167 style clone of a Proxy contract, points the Proxy to an        implementation and initializes it.

setImplementationAddress(address).notice: Sets the address of the Proxy implementation to clone.
